content: Don't waste your money like I did. This app is for people who have never been around a dog or any animal in general.

Interesting app. Could use more detail. Most people dont get or are able to read a dogs body language. They have no clue there is such a thing. For example, Many think a dog barking at another dog means the dog wants to play. But depending on the body posture, it could mean more. ..aggresdion, fear. The app is a good start, but referals to indepth reading of body language would be a big help. There are books out thete on tjis subject. Good start to a serious matter. Reading our dogs. ðŸ˜ƒ

Not sure what to think except it seem a bit too childish for me. I went there wanting to know what to do with my anxious very small dogs who become territorial when we are out with the other two. He swings on his lead and become a rottweiler! trying to get to the dog on coming. It's s got the point of not taking them out. so this app doesn't help me at all from that perspective.

Too expensive for enhanced flash cards. Could use a better glossary (is "appeasing" good or bad in this context?). Learn and quiz cards should be different. More than one variation of each mood would be useful, perhaps with some real dogs alomg with the drawings.
it is a well thought out app that is easy for people learning. great info for begginers on body language
Relly not much info in here. Very cursory info.

It's a decent app, but the few minutes I played with it, the quizzes were too easy. Didn't seem there was much to the app aside from the quiz and definitions. this would be good for someone not familiar with dogs or is getting a dog for the first time.

This is may be the very best, easy to use and extremely informative resource for teaching about canine communication and body language that there is, app or website. Just fantastic. I instruct all my clients to get it.
It's great. We need more!
Does not help to us if a dog is in pain
I'm a professional dog trainer and I love this app. I'm simplified and informative for the every day individual. I'm recommending to it everyone.
"Spot" on and very helpful!
Love it,lots of info verry helpful

Fantastic app. Dogs talk in body language and often people don't get the message until the dog is shouting, by which time it's too late. This app gives the user a grounding in dogspeak that every owner should possess.
replyContent: Thanks for taking the time to review the app. We're glad you like it.

content: Really like the app and think it will be very helpful for my students. I second Vanessa in saying that more quiz questions would be great.
replyContent: Thanks for the review and support. We're looking at more quizzes, as well.

content: Great App
replyContent: Thanks Mary, we appreciate your support.

content: As a dog trainer, it's so much more easier to teach clients how to understand their dog's body language! Would love more questions in the quiz but superb app none-the-less!
replyContent: Thanks Vanessa! And for using it with your clients. We appreciate your support for the very much needed education.

content: This a great app for anyone to use to better understand their dogs body language. It's informational, simple to use,  and fun for the family. I am a dog trainer and will be recommending to all of my clients to download it. It's also a great app for the family to use and learn dog body language together with their kids.
replyContent: Thanks, Brent for recommending this to your clients and helping to further this education. If we can't communicate, we can't bond. :)

content: I am a veterinarian and I own and operate Special Needs Pet Boarding. Many of the dogs my clients bring have special needs that are behavioral in nature. I often use the DogDecoder as a visual aid in discussing how important it is to not over-anthropomorphize with their dog and to not expect their dog to understand English without training. The app helps me help them get started on better hearing what their dog is trying to tell them. I appreciate very much that the app is designed with such clarity. Sometimes, clients are simply impressed and therefore listen more closely when they're made aware that the language of the dog is a subject important enough to have an app written for it.
replyContent: I love that you see it's value, this way Dr. Maier. This is exactly one of the reasons that I created the app. thank you for helping your dog owners learn to read their dogs.

content: Dog Decoder teaches you how to communicate with your dog(s) so that you may live a harmonious life together. Useful in many situations to promote positive interactions for all involved including children's education, vet offices and programs, dog trainers, dog parents, and anyone who loves dogs! Highly recommend.
replyContent: Thanks, Jac for seeing the value of the app in all these genres.
